title: Ticket #1446: Schedd needs D_ALWAYS about new jobs
description:
Given that queuing new jobs is a core part of the schedd's purpose, it's surprising that there isn't a D_ALWAYS in which it acknowledges that it has queued new jobs. This can complicate debugging. The schedd should do so.

There is a risk of flooding the log of a busy queue. Perhaps it's not a problem: if you're submitting 100,000 jobs in quick succession, maybe 100,000 log entries isn't really that big of a deal. If the largest jobs tend to be clusters, perhaps the schedd could collect them in a single log message ("Accepted jobs 98.0-98.100000"). The schedd could also group all new jobs within a single minute ("Accepted jobs 98-99, 200000 total clusters.").
